title-group.article-title: Propeller Development for the Rutan Voyager

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1990 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The Voyager was designed to become the first aircraft to circumnavigate the globe non-stop without refueling. Three sets of optimized propellers were designed to help increase its range. The first two sets had wooden blades with fiberglass facings. These were abandoned after four failures made their reliability questionable. A third pair of metal propellers was designed, and these were used on the record-setting flight. This paper documents the rationale, theory, and methods used to develop suitable propeller designs for the Voyager. Because of the historical significance of the aircraft, an attempt has been made to include historical details not documented elsewhere.

ref.mixed-citation: Betz, A.: Luftschrauben mit geringsten Energieverlust, (Screw Propellers with Minimum Energy Loss), Reports of the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Flow Research, 1919. (See also Appendix by L. Prandtl.)
Glauert, H.: Airplane Propellers , Div. L, Vol. IV of Aerodynamic Theory, edited by Durand. Springer Verlag, 1935.
Goldstein, S.: On the Vortex Theory of Screw Propellers, Proceedings of the Royal Society, Series A, Vol. 123. London, 1929.
Larrabee, E. E.: Practical Design of Minimum Induced Loss Propellers, SAE Technical Paper 790585, 1979.
Larrabee, E. E.: Design of Propellers for Motorsoarers , NASA CP-2085, Part 1, 1979.
Larrabee, E. E.: The Screw Propeller, Scientific American, Vol. 243, No. 1, pp. 134-146. July, 1980.
Larrabee, E. E.: Five Years Experience with Minimum Induced Loss Propellers, Part 1 - Theory; Part 2 - Applications. SAE Technical Papers 840026 & 840027, 1984.
Larrabee, E. E. & Drela, M.: Design and Analysis of Efficient Propellers. Submitted to the Journal of Propulsion and Power. Preprint furnished by Dr. Larrabee.
Summey, D. C. & Smetana, F. O.: Prediction of Light Aircraft Horizontal Tail Onset Flows - A Review and Analysis. NASA CR-2774, April, 1977.
Eppler, R.: Direct Calculation of Airfoils from Pressure Distribution. NASA TTF-15, 417, 1974.
Bauer, F., Garabedian, P. & Korn, D.: A Theory of Supercritical Wing Sections, with Computer Programs and Examples. Springer-Verlag, New York, 1972.
Gregorek, G. M.: Airfoil Design for Wind Turbines. Paper presented at the Wind Turbine Aerodynamics Seminar, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 1985.
Yeager, J. & Rutan, R.: Voyager. Alfred A. Knopf, New York, 1987.
